oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from William Sadler to Margaret and Elise Croft
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from William J. Sadler to Margaret and Elise Croft discussing the gift of Grassmere to the Nashville Children's Museum. Mr Sadler thanks the Croft sisters for their donation and tells them how much he admires their farm.

In 1964, Margaret and Elise Croft donated the Grassmere property to the Children's Museum of Nashville to be used as a "nature study center." As part of the agreement, the sisters would live on the property until their deaths and the Museum would pay taxes and maintain the property. Margaret passed away in 1974. After Elise's death in 1985, the Museum developed Grassmere Wildlife Park on the property, which opened in 1990 and closed in 1995. In 1996, the Nashville Zoo moved from Joelton to Grassmere where it remains to this day.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Family farms--Tennessee--History; Dwellings--Tennessee--Nashville
